alert.note: Alert for Grayson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 25 at 12:03AM CDT until April 25 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Grayson County in north central Texas... * Until 200 AM CDT. * At 1203 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. Flash flooding is already occurring. Emergency management has reported numerous road closures, as well as stalled vehicles due to flooding, particularly along the Highway 75 corridor through Sherman. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sherman, Denison, Whitesboro, Howe, Pottsboro, Collinsville, Gunter, Bells, Knollwood, Dorchester, Eisenhower State Park, Southmayd, Tioga, Sadler and Luella. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
